body: This quickfix should probably only go into the 0.7 branch for the 0.7.1 release since the new Akka-based JM/TMs have this issue fixed.

title: [FLINK-1237] Add support for custom partitioners
body:
- Functions: GroupReduce, Reduce, Aggregate on UnsortedGrouping, SortedGrouping (Java API & Scala API)
- Manual partition on DataSet (Java API & Scala API)
- Distinct operations provide semantic properties for preservation of distinctified fields
- Tests for pushown (or not pushdown) of custom partitionings and forced rebalancing
- Tests for GlobalProperties matching of partitionings
- Caching of generated requested data properties for unary operators

title: [FLINK-1172] Fix broken links in documentation

title: [FLINK-1244] setCombinable() returns operator
[FLINK-1173] Add socket text stream as a data source for the streaming API
body:
Check more detail information in [JIRA](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-1173).
1. Add SocketTextStreamFunction class for a new stream source
2. Add socketTextStream method into StreamExecutionEnvironment
3. Add unit test for SocketTextStreamFunction class

Tested with `mvn verify` command.

title: [FLINK-1245] Introduce TypeHints for Java API operators
body:
This PR contains:
- .returns(String), .returns(TypeInformation), .returns(Class) for all Java API UdfOperators
- a new UnknownTypeInfo with a corresponding new UnknownTypeSerializer which uses Kryo in a special configuration
- the TypeExtractor does not throw Exceptions anymore if it recognizes type erasure, 
  instead it prints log warnings and returns a UnknownTypeInfo
- Java 8 Lambdas can now be compiled and run with Oracle JDK for development (not efficient due to UnknownTypeInfo)
- since TypeInfoParser is now "Public API" I reworked it such it also support Pojos
- Unit Tests test TypeHints, Serializers, TypeExtractor and Lambdas

title: [FLINK-377] [FLINK-671] Generic Interface / PAPI
body:
This PR contains the new Generic Language Interface and the Python API built on top of it.

This version hasn't been tested yet on a cluster, this will be done over the weekend. I'm making the PR already so that the reviewing portion starts earlier. (since only minor changes will be necessary to make it work)

I will mark several parts where i specifically would like some input on.

Relevant issues:
Ideally, [FLINK-1040] will be merged before this is one, as it removes roughly 600 lines of very much hated code in the PlanBinder.

A while ago the distributed cache was acting up, not maintaining files across subsequent operations. I will verify whether this issue still exists while testing. That would not strictly be a blocking issue, as it stands i could work around that (with the caveat that a few files will remain in the tmp folder).

title: enable CSV Reader to ignore invalid lines like an empty line at the end and comments - FLINK-1208
body:
Corresponding to issue FLINK-1208:
enable CSV Reader to ignore invalid lines like an empty line at the end, multiple header lines or comments without throwing an exception

title: [FLINK-1243] Remove JVM MaxPermSize parameter when we use Java 8
body: JVM for Java 8 doesn't accept MaxPermSize parameter so let's remove it when we use Java 8.

title: [scala] Self-contained build for scala examples
body:
The scala examples lack self-contained build, because the default data is located in the flink-java-examples jar. Here is a proposed solution for that.

@aljoscha, @rmetzger what do you think?

Cheers,

Marton

title: [FLINK-1235] Compiler accepts iterations referenced from the static path of other iterations
body:
- Fix NepheleJobGraphGenerator to support iterations referenced on the static path of another iteration
- Catch nested iterations on dynamic path properly in optimizer (and give a good error message)

title: [FLINK-1221] Use the source line as the default operator name
body:
Before this change, we were using the class name for naming transformations.

With the change, we use the line of code where the dataset transformation is being called.
For example `org.apache.flink.api.java.operators.NamesTest.testJoinWith(NamesTest.java:92)` would be a name of a Join.

All this applies only if the user does not specify a name.

title: [FLINK-1226] Add API support for passing Configurations to InputFormats
[FLINK-1230] Add documentation and an example for collection-based execution
[FLINK-1040] Make type() call in projections optional (or remove it)
body:
The original version of projection requires a type() to specify the types of output dataset, e.g., dataset.project(0).type(string.class)). Now, I implement a new interface projection() which does not require the type() call, i.e., dataset.projection(0). Similarly, I modify the operation of JoinOperator and CrossOperator. In particular, some changes in ProjectorOperator.java, JoinOperator.java and CrossOperator.java are generated by TupleGenerator.java.

I add more testing cases here. In addition, I rewrite a new example of web log analysis by the projection() API.

title: [FLINK-1323] Add an I/O writer implementation that uses callbacks on completed write requests
body:
- also refactors the I/O Manager Readers and Writers to interfaces
  -  allows for a very simple way of plugging in a synchronous version of the I/O manager (currently all I/O is asynchronous)

title: [FLINK-1227] KeySelector can now extend ResultTypeQueryable
[FLINK-1095] Remove info option from CliFrontend
[FLINK-983] Fix WebClient truncated function names.
[FLINK-1219] Add support for Apache Tez as execution backend
body:
This allows Flink programs to be executed as Tez DAGs.

Up for comments, not good to merge yet.

The commit to make hadoop2 the default profile will eventually be a separate commit and issue,

title: [Flink-1142] Log information about IOManager temp directories.
body:
Log the percentage of available space on the disk (total, free, percentage)
Remove those from the list with less than the defined threshold (with a WARN-message)

title: [FLINK-1223] Allow value escaping in CSV files.
body:
Strings can now contain " quoted characters
Skip trailing whitespace after quote

title: [FLINK-1215] Fix spurious failures when creating output directories due to I/O races
[FLINK-1220] Promote various log statements to INFO level.
body: Add log statements for assignment locations

title: [FLINK-1008] Fix createProgramPlan() throws exception
body:
Problem was, that ExecutionEnvironment#getExecutionPlan clears the data
sinks, i.e. a following ExecutionEnvironment#execute will throw an error
because there are no data sinks.

This introduces a new flag for ExecutionEnvironment#createProgramPlan to
indicate, that the the sinks shall not be cleared.
This does not break any existing code.

title: [FLINK-1218] Don't use "new Integer". Use "Integer.valueOf" instead.
body:
There are lots of "new Integer" or something like it in the code.
We should use valueOf to avoid wasted instance creation.

title: [FLINK-1217] Keepalive option should be set to sockets in Client and Server
body:
Sockets in Client and Server is not set keepalive option.
I think we should set keepalive option to socket to detect hang or network disconnection.

title: [FLINK-1213] Add .gitattributes to normalize EOL character.
body: Flink has Windows batch files and Linux user, Mac OSX user and Windows user can edit those files. So I think we should normalize EOL character of batch files using .gitattributes.

title: [FLINK-1212] Interpreter directive in shell scripts should be "/usr/bin/env bash" instead of "/bin/bash"
body: There are some scripts which interpreter directive are "#!/bin/bash". We should use "#!/usr/bin/env bash" instead.

title: [FLINK-1211] EOL character of Windows Batch files should be CRLF
body: Flink has some Windows Batch files. Windows expects the EOL character of Batch file is CRLF, not LF.

title: [FLINK-1113] clean up JQuery dependencies
[FLINK-1191] Add support for Scala Collections and Special Types
body:
"The special types" are Option and Either. This should work for all
Scala collections except SortedSet and SortedMap, for which the type
checker prints an error message.

title: Improved input type inference, bug fixing, code simplification
body: The input type inference has been improved to support also complicated use cases. It is now far more robust. I also tried to simplify the code a little bit by introducing helper functions.

title: [FLINK-1202] Remove partial files when file outputs fail (or are canceled)
body: Builds upon #174

title: [FLINK-1203] Deactivate fork reuse in tests ()
body:
Works around a potential surefire bug where we see confused class cast exceptions

```
java.lang.ClassCastException: org.apache.flink.api.common.operators.base.DeltaIterationBase cannot be cast to org.apache.flink.api.common.operators.base.GroupReduceOperatorBase
    at org.apache.flink.api.scala.operators.translation.DistinctTranslationTest.testCombinable(DistinctTranslationTest.scala:39)
```

title: [FLINK-1139] Fix for HadoopOF with DOP > 1
body:
This PR allows to execute HadoopOFs with DOP > 1.
It adds a hook to JM that is executed after the last OutputFormat finished. 
Hadoop FileOutputFormats need this hook to clean-up temporary files.

title: Upgraded APIs: Flink (0.8) and HBase (0.98.x) + profiles
body: I had to create an hadoop.core.version variable to manage the fact that cloudera has different versions for hadoop-core and hadoop-common..

title: Change TypeExtractor to support interfaces within classes
body:
Before, the pojo analyzer would try to analyze a field of type List
or Map and fail. Now we catch the exception and create a GenericTypeInfo
for the enclosing class because the avro serializer can in fact
serialize objects that have fields of interface type.

This is a very easy fix. What do you think?

(BTW, another PR from the bus. :smile: )

title: Improve error messages in case of invalid file paths or URIs
body:
Gives hints for cases when the most probable error cause is a forgotten slash '/'.
Improves message on non-qualified file URIs

Another round to remove final modifier to private methods because it is not needed
body:
Remove final modifier to private methods because it is not needed. 
Those methods are final by default.

body: Case class which implement the Value or Writable interface are now treated as one of those types. This allows to add custom serialization logic to case classes.

First part of rebase runtime support for intermediate results
body:
This is the current standing of a rebase for FLINK-986. Be prepared for forced pushes to this branch. The rebase is work in progress and I need to add some final tests and test in cluster mode. The PR is for interested parties to have an overview of where things stand (although this is just part of the commits).

My timeline to finalize the PR is until Friday. So don't merge this.

I also have an overview graphic that covers what the changes entail for the network stack and I will add detailed descriptions here.

title: [FLINK-1143] Allow delta iterations that do not join with the solution set
[FLINK-1148] Create a writeAsCsv(path, writemode) variant

Enable forgotten JoinITCase (for POJOs) for Scala and Java API
body: @aljoscha: Could you quickly review my Scala changes?

title: [FLINK-1019] Implementation of akka based RPC system
body:
Replaced the old Nephele RPC service with akka based system. Thus, several components are now implemented as actors. This includes the JobManager, TaskManager, MemoryArchivist, JobClient. The legacy RPC service and the corresponding protocols are removed. 

Replaced also the execution service of the ExecutionGraph by akka's futures to unify the system. 

Removed the LocalInstanceManager whose task is now handled by the InstanceManager. The responsibility to create local task managers is now delegated to the FlinkMiniCluster. 

The EventCollector was removed and the respective event classes. The events are now directly sent to the respective listeners. 

Moved the resources of the WebInfoServer and the WebInterfaceServer to the resource folders of the corresponding projects. As a consequence these resources are bundled with the jars and directly served from them by Jetty. 

The yarn client was adapted to communicate with the actors. The former ApplicationMaster is combined with the JobManager to simplify the system. The uber-jar is now created with maven's shading plugin.

Since this is a big change I would be happy if another pair of eyes could take a look at it.

title: [doc] Update programming guide for scala expression keys
[FLINK-1151] Adds BaseStatistics for CollectionDataSources
body:
Adds statistics for collection data sources based on collection size and serializer information.
Adds getMinimumLength() to TypeSerializer to get a lower bound for size estimates.

title: [FLINK-1150] Fix output size estimate of FilterNode.
body:
FilterNode implicitly sets the estimated output size to unknown (-1) while adjusting the cardinality by a factor of 0.5.
This fix changes the estimated output size proportional to cardinality.

title: [FLINK-1136] Put Flink logo in web clients.
body:
Replaced Flink logo in web submission client.
Added Flink logo to JobManager web interface.
Updated Run Example Quickstart screenshots
Removed old gradients and unused image files from submission client.

body: Do you agree?

Tests and documentation included. Also tested on cluster.

I hijacked @twalthr's PR #131 to build the documentation of the Hadoop function wrappers on top.

Add an object-based variant of the solution set
[FLINK-1110] Add collection-based execution mode to flink APIs
body: This modes executes programs straightforwardly as collections, with minimal resource footprint and virtually no latency (such as starting threads, RPC services, actor systems, ...)

title: Flink 1134
body: fix for https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-1134

title: [FLINK-1133] TypeExtractor resolves also variables inside Tuple-input
body:
Until now the TypeExtractor only supported simple input derivation from functions like "Function<T, TupleXY<T,..>>".

This PR adds the support for functions with variables in input tuples like "Function<TupleXY<T,...>, T>."

title: Updated run example quickstart (commands, screenshots)
body:
- Fixed outdated screenshots (web client with Stratosphere logo and other version of plot script).
- Fixed updated package of Java examples for call of data generator.
- Minor improvements.

title: [FLINK-12] Clean up configuration object
body:
- Remove class loader (was inconsistently used and set)
- Objects are stored in their type, rather than as a string
- casting happens on object (for numbers) with fallback to parsing of the string representation
- global configuration reuses config object, rather than re-implementing config logic.

title: yarn client tests
body:
This PR integrates tests for the YARN client into our system.

The client needs the already build yarn uberjar for apache flink. To make it available, I had to create a new maven module so that the tests run after the building of the jar in flink-dist.

Also, the setting of the environment is a little bit strange in YarnTestBase. A workaround for this would be to use a custom ProcessBuilder and introduce a set of exit codes in the Yarn Client. So thats open for discussion.

title: Guava shading and dependencies cleanup
body:
- add "flink-shading" for shaded libraries (currently guava only)
- relocate guava in all projects and exclude it from the lib and exported dependencies
- Exlude unnecessary transitive dependencies from hadoop 1

Builds on top of #130

title: Scala first n partition
[FLINK-1107] Hadoop Compatibility Layer documented
body:
This PR contains the Hadoop Compatibility Layer documentation and some small typo fixes. 

Maybe it would make sense to introduce a special "Add-ons" top-level section instead of putting it under "Programming Guides"?

title: [FLINK-1072] improved build matrix
body:
This pull request changes the build matrix to build all versions that we publish as a release binary + the latest hadoop release (curr 2.5.0).

We should not merge this since the hadoop 2.5.0 build will fail due to FLINK-1069.

title: [FLINK-514]  Fixed javadoc problems in various problems
body:
This pull requests fixes all javadoc warnings as reported by the maven build process except for the warnings from the flink-streaming-core module. flink-streaming-core references interfaces in the javadoc which do not exist anymore and it is not obvious to me how to change the javadoc.

The code changes in the pull request only affect javadoc. No actual program code has been touched.

title: Change Partition Operator to actual general-purpose Operator
body:
It is no longer a special-case operator that can only be used in front
of map-style operations.

title: Cleanup LOG.debug to make sure no extra toString and unnecessary String concatenation
body:
The PR contains:
-) Remove unnecessary type check and cast for FileInputSplit in FileInputFormat.java.
-) Update LOG.debug to user SLF4J parameterized logging or protected by LOG.isDebugEnabled to save toString and String concat. I use SLF4J parameterized logging if it is just logging String or object via its toString and add LOG.isDebugEnabled if it requires calling method to get the message/object.

Pass tests.

title: Integration of Daniel's BLOB manager
body:
I rebased the pull request #107 of @warneke. Thanks for your work Daniel, the code looks really good. Since the master evolved a little bit from the version of the pull request, I'd like to have another pair of eyes looking over it. I tried to address the problem of old jar files which are no longer used by introducing a clean up task which regularly looks for those files. Due to this I had to extend the book keeping of the LibraryCacheManager a little bit.

I tested WordCount and Kmeans on the cluster with this version.

title: Change logging backend of SLF4j from Logback to Log4j
body:
... for better compatibility with YARN.

We'll still ship the Logback configuration file and pass them their path to the JVM so that
users can use Flink with Logback as well.

Please do not merge this in the next 12 hours. I would like to test the changes on my laptop @ work. I have a Hortonworks sandbox there to test it.

title: [FLINK-953] Remove fake tail from iterations
body: Fake tails are no longer necessary with the reworked task hierarchy

title: Remove CONTRIBUTORS file to prefer dynamically generate it
body:
Per discussion in the dev@ list, maintaining the CONTRIBUTORS file manually is hard to do.

Most ASF projects defer this to team page or retrieveing it from JIRA or git commit list
for every release if needed.

This PR proposes to remove it and defer to dynamically created per release.

title: Major Rework of JobManager scheduling classes
body:
The new design separates scheduler, instance manager, and execution graph cleanly.
- Job graphs can be incrementally constructed
- The execution graph is a slim asynchronous state machine
- The scheduler picks instances and slots on demand and uses sharing groups / co-location constraints to implement resource sharing and co location
- The management graph is removed, timestamps for state transitions are attached to the execution graph 

This pull request fixes also the following issues
- FLINK-1094 (simplify input split assignment)
- FLINK-1030 (Cleanly separate the Instance Management and Resource Assignment)
- FLINK-1029 (Attach slot information to scheduling/assignment information in Scheduler)
- FLINK-989 (improve not enough slots SchedulingException message)
- FLINK-897 (Bug in scheduler for job graph instance sharing)
- FLINK-820 (Support for unconnected data flows - runtime parts)
- FLINK-625 (Add a fail(Exception) method to the job graph, to report problems detected in RPC calls)
- FLINK-230 (Job Cancellation does not work properly: "Cannot find execution graph to job ID")
- FLINK-165 (rework Nephele Task Hierarchy)
- FLINK-79 (Startup time of jobs)
- FLINK-15 (Rework Nephele Execution Graph State Machine)
- FLINK-13 (Bug in Nephele Scheduler)

title: [FLINK-1097] Fixed multiple slf4j bindings when using Hadoop2
body: I excluded all slf4j-log4j12 transitive dependencies to get rid off the warning that slf4j finds multiple slf4j bindings in the classpath. Additionally, I added log4j-over-slf4j and excluded all log4j transitive dependencies so that slf4j handles also legacy log4j logging messages from dependencies.
